channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nvidia Broke Antitrust Law, China Says, as Tensions With U.S. Mount
item.description: Chinese regulators, on a day of U.S. trade talks, said that an acquisition by Nvidia had violated antimonopoly regulations.

item.title: Trump, fascinated by the royals, gets a rare second U.K. state visit
item.description: Trump has long expressed fascination with the royal family. The U.K. government will tap into that this week during a state visit that combines pagean...

item.title: Democrats will 'either adapt or die' as strategists push them onto new platforms
item.description: Prominent Democratic lawmakers and influencers are encouraging their fellow Democrats to embrace social media and online video to reach voters or risk...

item.title: Best and Worst Moments From the 2025 Emmy Awards
item.description: It was a great night for new series, first-time winners and a late-night show canceled by the ceremony’s broadcaster. The writing and gags? Not as gre...

item.title: A record number of Congressional lawmakers aren't running for reelection in 2026. Here's the list
item.description: NPR is tracking the record number of lawmakers in Congress who have already announced they don't plan to run for reelection ahead of the 2026 midterms...

item.title: The World Wants More Vaccines. An Anti-Vaccine America Isn’t Helping.
item.description: Most governments are trying to fight vaccine hesitancy with science and investment, while the United States heads in the opposite direction.

item.title: A Utah church embarks on a healing journey in the aftermath of the Kirk assassination
item.description: A church in Orem, Utah, the city where Charlie Kirk was killed, brings healing during its Sunday service. "We're going to be navigating this as a comm...

item.title: Starvation and Bombs in Besieged Sudanese City As Residents Cry for Help
item.description: At least 260,000 civilians trapped in El Fasher face a dire choice: risk being starved or bombed if they stay, and raped or killed if they flee.

item.title: Melting glaciers mean an uncertain future for Europe's rivers
item.description: Europe is warming faster than any continent. That's speeding up glacial melt, which is already threatening Europe's largest rivers.

item.title: Starvation and Bombs in Besieged Sudanese City As Residents Cry for Help
item.description: At least 260,000 civilians trapped in El Fasher face a dire choice: risk being starved or bombed if they stay, and raped or killed if they flee.

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs Test Mark Carney’s Leadership in Canada
item.description: After a stunning election victory on an anti-Trump message, Prime Minister Mark Carney is adjusting to the realities of dealing with the United States...

item.title: Rubio, in Israel, Meets Netanyahu as Trump Grows Impatient
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio planned to discuss President Trump’s desire to see the war in Gaza end soon.

item.title: G.O.P. Plan on Pesticides Faces Revolt From MAHA Moms
item.description: The provision in the government funding bill could shield pesticide companies from billions of dollars in lawsuits.

item.title: The World Wants More Vaccines. An Anti-Vaccine America Isn’t Helping.
item.description: Most governments are trying to fight vaccine hesitancy with science and investment, while the United States heads in the opposite direction.

item.title: Arthur Sze Will Be the Next U.S. Poet Laureate
item.description: An observational poet who focuses on imagery from nature, he taught at the Institute of American Indian Arts for more than 20 years.
